remarks:
The intersection of a special case of a class abstraction. ` y ` may be free in ` ph ` and ` A ` , which can be thought of a ` ph ( y ) ` and ` A ( y ) ` .  Typically, ~ abrexex2 or ~ abexssex can be used to satisfy the second hypothesis.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 14-Nov-2016.) 

---

 The intersection of a special case of a class abstraction. ` y ` may be free in ` ph ` and ` A ` , which can be thought of a ` ph ( y ) ` and ` A ( y ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-2006.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 14-Nov-2016.)
statement:
intab.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
intab.2 $e |- { x | E. y ( ph /\ x = A ) } e. _V $.
intab $p |- |^| { x | A. y ( ph -> A e. x ) } = { x | E. y ( ph /\ x = A ) } $.
$d A x $.
$d ph x $.
$d x y $.
